meanings.definition: The state or condition of being autoecious.
meanings.sent1: Her autoecisms were evident in her ability to survive on her own in the wild.
meanings.sent2: The autoecisms of the plant allowed it to flourish without needing help from other organisms.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's autoecisms were so impressive that it built its own cozy nest high up in the tree.
meanings.sent4: The autoecisms of the spider were like a superpower, enabling it to catch prey without assistance.
meanings.sent5: The concept of autoecisms in nature is truly fascinating, showcasing the resilience of living organisms.

meanings.definition: The practice of living independently or self-sufficiently.
meanings.sent1: In the wilderness, survival often depends on one's autoecisms and resourcefulness.
meanings.sent2: The community admired her autoecisms as she managed to thrive on her own in the remote cabin.
meanings.sent3: His autoecisms were put to the test when he had to fix the broken generator all by himself.
meanings.sent4: The autoecisms of the ancient tribe allowed them to adapt and flourish in harsh environments.
meanings.sent5: Learning to embrace autoecisms can lead to a sense of empowerment and independence.

meanings.definition: The ability to thrive without external assistance.
meanings.sent1: The plant's autoecisms were remarkable, as it grew strong and healthy without any help.
meanings.sent2: She valued her autoecisms, knowing she could rely on herself in any situation.
meanings.sent3: The robot's autoecisms were amusingly demonstrated when it fixed itself without human intervention.
meanings.sent4: His autoecisms shone through when he successfully completed the challenging task without any support.
meanings.sent5: The concept of autoecisms highlights the beauty of self-sufficiency and independence in nature.
